۞ يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓا۟ إِنَّ كَثِيرًۭا مِّنَ ٱلْأَحْبَارِ وَٱلرُّهْبَانِ لَيَأْكُلُونَ أَمْوَٰلَ ٱلنَّاسِ بِٱلْبَـٰطِلِ وَيَصُدُّونَ عَن سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ ۗ وَٱلَّذِينَ يَكْنِزُونَ ٱلذَّهَبَ وَٱلْفِضَّةَ وَلَا يُنفِقُونَهَا فِى سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ فَبَشِّرْهُم بِعَذَابٍ أَلِيمٍۢ ٣٤

May Allah bless the ones upon Salafiyyah.

Despite what the deviants want you to believe, the middle path is the path of the salaf.

It is not the path of emotion, desire or opinion.

There is no "hardline salafist" or "overzealous-Salafi phase"

It is only truth vs falsehood.

Isa ibn Maryam (ﷺ) was only a Prophet and nowhere in the Gospel did he claim to be God.

Allah informed us of a conversation that will occur between Him and Isa.

مَا قُلْتُ لَهُمْ إِلَّا مَآ أَمَرْتَنِى بِهِۦٓ أَنِ ٱعْبُدُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ رَبِّى وَرَبَّكُمْ ۚ

"I (Isa) said not to them except what You commanded me - to worship Allāh, my Lord and your Lord." - (Al-Ma'idah - 117)

In the Bible, Isa was reported to have said the same:

"The most important one,” answered Jesus, “is this: ‘Hear, O Israel: The Lord our God, the Lord is one. Love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your mind and with all your strength" - (Mark 12:29-30)

Isa in Quran said he is a Servant of Allah:

قَالَ إِنِّى عَبْدُ ٱللَّهِ ءَاتَىٰنِىَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ وَجَعَلَنِى نَبِيًّۭا

"[Jesus] said, "Indeed, I am the servant of Allāh. He has given me the Scripture and made me a prophet." - (Surah Maryam 30)

In the Bible, Isa was reported to have said the same:

"By myself I can do nothing; I judge only as I hear, and my judgment is just, for I seek not to please myself but him who sent me." - (John 5:30)

It is only from the traditions of the currupt Christians that he is labeled anything more then a Messenger of Allah.

As this is all he said about himself:

"Nevertheless I must walk to day, and to morrow, and the day following: for it cannot be that a prophet perish out of Jerusalem." - (Luke 13:33)

Isa ibn Maryam (ﷺ) is free from those who exaggerated his status.

And they will be the losers who will reside in the hellfire for eternity.

I ask Allah to guide the Christians to the truth, and unite us upon what all the Messengers were upon.

"Say, "O People of the Scripture, come to a word that is equitable between us and you - that we will not worship except Allāh and not associate anything with Him and not take one another as lords instead of Allāh."1 But if they turn away, then say, "Bear witness that we are Muslims [submitting to Him]." - (Ali 'Imran 64)

Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said: 

"The Hour will not be established until the son of Mary (i.e. Jesus) descends amongst you as a just ruler, he will break the cross, kill the pigs, and abolish the Jizya tax. Money will be in abundance so that nobody will accept it (as charitable gifts)."
(Sahih al-Bukhari 2476)

"When God alone is not the ultimate goal of the servant’s desire and the end of his purpose, and He is the beloved and desired one for him by nature and the first purpose, and everything else is only loved, desired, and sought after for His sake, then he has not fulfilled the testimony that there is no god but God, and he has in him a deficiency, a defect, and polytheism to the extent of that, and he has the causes of that in terms of pain, regret, and torment according to what he missed of that."

Ibn Al-Qayyim said:

"Whoever knows God Almighty, His names and attributes best, desires Him most, loves Him most, and is closest to Him. He found in his heart a sweetness that cannot be expressed, and can only be known through taste and longing.

 When the heart tastes that, it cannot give precedence to love for anyone else, or his relatives. And the more his love for Him increases, the more his servitude, humility, submission, and bondage to Him increases, and he is free from the bondage of others.

The heart cannot prosper, be rectified, find joy, delight, pleasure, tranquility, or peace except through the worship and love of its Lord and turning to Him in repentance. 

Even if it were to possess all the pleasures of creation, it would not find contentment or peace in them; rather, they would only increase its need and anxiety until it attains what it was created and prepared for: that God alone be the ultimate goal and the fulfillment of its desires. 

For within it lies an inherent need for its Lord and God, insofar as He is its object of worship, its beloved, its God, and its ultimate goal, just as within it lies an inherent need for Him insofar as He is its Lord, its Creator, its Provider, and its Sustainer. And whenever the love of God takes root in the heart and strengthens therein, it expels from it any worship or servitude to anything other than Him.

He became free, honorable, and dignified. His face shone with light and radiance.

There is no believer who does not have in his heart love for God Almighty, tranquility in remembering Him, delight in knowing Him, pleasure and joy in remembering Him, longing to meet Him, and comfort in being near Him, even if he does not feel it, because his heart is preoccupied with something else, and he is distracted by what he is preoccupied with. The existence of something is not the same as feeling and being aware of it.

Its strength, weakness, increase, and decrease: are according to the strength, weakness, increase, and decrease of faith.

When God alone is not the ultimate goal of the servant’s desire and the end of his purpose, and He is the beloved and desired one for him by nature and the first purpose, and everything else is only loved, desired, and sought after for His sake, then he has not fulfilled the testimony that there is no god but God, and he has in him a deficiency, a defect, and polytheism to the extent of that, and he has the causes of that in terms of pain, regret, and torment according to what he missed of that.

Even if one were to strive for this desired goal by every means and try every avenue, without seeking God's help, relying on Him, and acknowledging one's dependence on Him for its attainment, and without being certain that it can only be achieved through His grace, will, and assistance—for there is no other way whatsoever—he would not achieve his goal. For whatever God wills comes to pass, and whatever He does not will does not come to pass. Therefore, none but He can lead to it, none but He can guide to it, none but He can be worshipped except through His assistance, and none but He can be obeyed except by His will."

(Ighāthat al-Lahfān min Maṣāyid al-Shayṭān, vol. 2, pg. 197-198)

Despairing and not trusting in Allah is the root of these peoples problems.

They have lost all hope, so much so, that they now have adopted an approach of removing Israel by any means.

Even if those means are Kuffar, who will rule in contrary to the Shariah.

Any Muslim who hopes for the Taghut to take power, in any case, is a disbeliever.

Shaykh Sulaymān ibn Sahmān said it well:

"So whoever believes that implementing the Islamic Sharia leads to fighting and discord, and that unity and harmony can only be achieved under the rule of the ṭāghūt, is a kaafir, an enemy of Allah and all the messengers. 

For this is exactly the belief of the disbelievers of Quraysh, who thought the truth lay in what their forefathers followed, rather than what Allah sent His Messenger with.”

Second point:

If you know that referring to the ṭāghūt for judgment is Kufr, then know that Allah has stated in His Book that disbelief is worse than killing:

“And fitnah is worse than killing.” (Al-Baqarah 2:217)

and “Fitnah is worse than killing.” (Al-Baqarah 2:191).

The term fitnah here means Kufr. So even if the desert dwellers and the townsfolk were to fight one another until they perished, it would still be lighter than establishing a ṭāghūt on earth who rules contrary to the Sharia of Islam which Allah sent His Messenger with.

Third point:
If this kind of judgment is Kufr, and disputes are only over worldly matters, then how could you justify committing kufr for the sake of this world? A person does not truly believe until Allah and His Messenger are dearer to him than everything else, and until the Messenger is dearer to him than his child, his parent, and all people.

So even if you were to lose all your worldly possessions, it would never be permissible to seek judgment from the ṭāghūt for their sake. And even if someone forced you, giving you a choice between appealing to the ṭāghūt or giving up your worldly goods, you would be obliged to sacrifice them, and it would not be permissible for you to resort to the ṭāghūt.”
(Ad Durar as Saniyyah 10/509 511)

In this Hadith which the Shia's have authenticated refers to cursing "The Two idols of Quraysh and their daughters"

Which they say is Abu Bakr and Umar, and their daughters, Aisha and Hafsa

"Ibn Abbas, on the authority of Ali, peace be upon him, that he used to recite this supplication in his prayer and said 

"O God (2) [bless Muhammad and the family of Muhammad and] curse the two idols of Quraysh, their two false gods, their two false deities, their two lies, and their two daughters (3), who disobeyed Your command, denied Your revelation, rejected Your favor, disobeyed (4) Your Messenger, distorted Your religion, altered Your book, [loved Your enemies and denied Your blessings], nullified Your rulings, invalidated Your obligations, deviated from Your verses, opposed Your allies, befriended Your enemies, ruined Your lands, and corrupted Your servants."

(Kitāb Sulaym ibn Qays, p. 587, Hadith 4, and by al-Kafʿamī in Al-Balad al-Amīn wa Jannat al-Amān, and al-Majlisī, Biḥār al-Anwār) 

If you have doubts about this referring to Abu Bakr, Umar, Aisha and Hafsa.

Then let the authorative scholars of this disgraceful religion clear that up for you.

(al-Maḥajja al-Bayḍā pg. 222)

"There is no god but Allah, I attacked him with a spear. It once occurred to me and I talked about it to the Apostle (ﷺ). The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: Did he profess" There is no god but Allah," and even then you killed him? I said: Messenger of Allah, he made a profession of it out of the fear of the weapon. He (the Holy Prophet) observed: Did you tear his heart in order to find out whether it had professed or not?" - (Sahih Muslim 96)

"Muḥammad is the Messenger of Allāh; and those with him are forceful against the disbelievers, merciful among themselves." - (Surah Al-Fath - 29)

"Invite to the way of your Lord with wisdom and good instruction, and argue with them in a way that is best. Indeed, your Lord is most knowing of who has strayed from His way, and He is most knowing of who is [rightly] guided." - (An-Nahl - 125)

The Prophet (ﷺ) said, 

"Make things easy for the people, and do not make it difficult for them, and make them calm (with glad tidings) and do not repulse (them )." - (Sahih al-Bukhari 6125)

"So by mercy from Allāh, [O Muḥammad], you were lenient with them. And if you had been rude [in speech] and harsh in heart, they would have disbanded from about you. So pardon them and ask forgiveness for them and consult them in the matter. And when you have decided, then rely upon Allāh. Indeed, Allāh loves those who rely [upon Him]." - (Ali 'Imran - 159)

"By time, Indeed, mankind is in loss, Except for those who have believed and done righteous deeds and advised each other to truth and advised each other to patience." - (Surah Al-'Asr)

"And if you ask them, they will surely say, "We were only conversing and playing." Say, "Is it Allāh and His verses and His Messenger that you were mocking? Make no excuse; you have disbelieved [i.e., rejected faith] after your belief. If We pardon one faction of you - We will punish another faction because they were criminals." - (At-Tawbah - 65-66)

"Whoever disbelieves in [i.e., denies] Allāh after his belief... except for one who is forced [to renounce his religion] while his heart is secure in faith. But those who [willingly] open their breasts to disbelief, upon them is wrath from Allāh, and for them is a great punishment" - (An-Nahl - 106)

"How many observers of prayer are there who profess with their tongue what is not in their heart? Upon this the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: I have not been commanded to pierce through the hearts of people, nor to split their bellies (insides)." - (Sahih Muslim 1064)

"And I did not create the jinn and mankind except to worship Me." - (Adh-Dhariyat - 56)

"And they were not commanded except to worship Allāh, [being] sincere to Him in religion, inclining to truth, and to establish prayer and to give zakāh. And that is the correct religion." - (Al-Bayyinah - 5)

"But if they turn away - then We have not sent you, [O Muḥammad], over them as a guardian; upon you is only [the duty of] notification/conveyance." - (Ash-Shuraa - 48)

"And do not pursue that of which you have no knowledge. Indeed, the hearing, the sight and the heart - about all those [one] will be questioned." - (Al-Isra - 36)

Ibn Taymiyyah said:

"If someone utters a word of disbelief with his tongue without need, deliberately and knowingly, that it is a word of disbelief, then he disbelieves by that outwardly and inwardly. 

It is not permissible to say that inwardly he may be a believer. Whoever says that has departed from Islam.

 God Almighty said: {Whoever disbelieves in God after having believed, except for one who is forced [to renounce his faith] while his heart is secure in faith. But those who willingly open their breasts to disbelief - upon them is wrath from God, and for them is a great punishment . }

It is known that the term "disbelief" here does not refer to mere belief in the heart, because a person cannot be forced into that. The verse excludes those who are coerced. 

It does not refer to those who merely utter words and believe, because the verse excludes those who are coerced, who are not forced to make a covenant or utter a statement, but only to utter it. 

Thus, it is understood that the verse refers to anyone who utters a word of disbelief, incurring God's wrath and a severe punishment, and who is considered a disbeliever for that, except for those who are coerced while remaining steadfast in their faith. 

However, anyone who willingly embraces disbelief while coerced is also a disbeliever. Therefore, everyone who utters disbelief is a disbeliever, except for those who are coerced and utter words of disbelief while remaining steadfast in their faith. 

God Almighty said regarding the mockers: {Make no excuses; you have disbelieved after your belief.} He clarified that they are disbelievers by their words, even though they did not believe in their truth. 

This is a broad topic, and its understanding is based on what has been previously mentioned: that belief in the heart prevents the intention to speak or perform an act of contempt and disdain, just as it necessitates love and veneration. 

The presence or absence of this in the heart is a matter established by God's way with His creation, just as the perception of what is pleasurable necessitates the perception of the opposite of pain, so if the effect is absent, it necessitates the absence of the cause, and if the opposite is found, it necessitates the absence of the other opposite. 

So speech and action that include belittling and contempt necessitate the absence of beneficial belief and the absence of submission and surrender, and therefore it is disbelief.

Know that faith, even if it is said to be belief, means that the heart believes in the truth, the words are believed in the heart, and actions confirm the words."
(as-Sarim al-Maslul ala Shatim ar-Rasul pg. 524)

Ibn Taymiyyah said:

"Likewise, whoever calls upon other than God and makes pilgrimage to other than God is also a polytheist, and what he did is disbelief, but he may not know that this is forbidden polytheism.

Many people from the Tatars and others entered Islam while they had small idols made of felt and other materials, and they would approach and venerate them without knowing that this was forbidden [in the religion of Islam, and they would also approach the fire without knowing that this was forbidden] . 

Many types of polytheism may be hidden from some who entered Islam and they do not know that it is polytheism. This person is misguided and his act of polytheism is invalid, but he does not deserve punishment until the proof is established against him."
((al-Ikhna'iyyah aw ar-Radd 'ala al-Ikhna'i pg. 205)

The Permanent Committee for Islamic Research and Fatwas in Saudi Arabia.
Under the supervision of Shaykh ‘Abdul-‘Azīz ibn ‘Abdullāh ibn Bāz 

Fatwah no. 4400:

"So clarifying the matter and establishing the proof (iqāmat al-ḥujjah) is for the purpose of removing any excuse before carrying out the PUNISHMENT upon him, NOT IN ORDER FOR HIM TO BE CALLED A DISBELIEVER ONLY AFTER THE CLARIFICATION.

Rather, HE IS CALLED A DISBELIEVER DUE TO THE ACT HE COMMITTED, such as prostrating to other than Allah, vowing as an act of worship to other than Him, or slaughtering an animal, like a sheep, for other than Allah..."
(Kitāb Fatāwā al-Lajnah al-Dā’imah – First Collection, vol. 1, p. 220)

Sulaymaan ibn Muhammad al-Munqari narrated to Us: ‘Abdoos ibn Maalik al-’Attaar narrated to me: I heard Aboo ‘Abdullaah Ahmad ibn Hanbal, may Allaah be pleased with him, saying: “The Fundamental Prindples of the Sunnah are:

Sulaymaan ibn Muhammad al-Munqari narrated
to Us: ‘Abdoos ibn Maalik al-’Attaar narrated to me: I heard
Aboo ‘Abdullaah Ahmad ibn Hanbal, may Allaah be pleased with him, saying:
“The Fundamental Prindples of the Sunnah are:

"6. And the abandonment of quarrelling, argumentation and controversy in the religion."
(Usul al-Sunnah pg. 11)

Abdullah ibn ‘Utbah reported: Umar ibn al-Khattab, may Allah be pleased with him, said, 

“Verily, people were judged by revelation in the time of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, and the revelation has ceased. We only judge now what is manifested outwardly of your deeds. Whoever shows us good, we will trust him and bring him close. It is not for us to judge anything of his inner secrets. Allah will hold him accountable for his inner secrets. Whoever shows us evil, we will never trust him or believe him even if it is said his intentions are good.”
(Sahih al-Bukhari 2641)

Allahu A 'lam.

يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓا۟ إِن تَنصُرُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ يَنصُرْكُمْ وَيُثَبِّتْ أَقْدَامَكُمْ

"O you who have believed, if you support Allāh, He will support you and plant firmly your feet." - (Surah Muhammed - 7)

مَّسَّتْهُمُ ٱلْبَأْسَآءُ وَٱلضَّرَّآءُ وَزُلْزِلُوا۟ حَتَّىٰ يَقُولَ ٱلرَّسُولُ وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ مَعَهُۥ مَتَىٰ نَصْرُ ٱللَّهِ ۗ أَلَآ إِنَّ نَصْرَ ٱللَّهِ قَرِيبٌۭ

"They were touched by poverty and hardship and were shaken until [even their] messenger and those who believed with him said, "When is the help of Allāh?" Unquestionably, the help of Allāh is near." - (Al-Baqarah - 214)

وَأُخْرَىٰ تُحِبُّونَهَا ۖ نَصْرٌۭ مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ وَفَتْحٌۭ قَرِيبٌۭ ۗ وَبَشِّرِ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ

"And [you will obtain] another [favor] that you love - victory from Allāh and an imminent conquest; and give good tidings to the believers." - (As-Saf - 13)

وَلَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَا مِن قَبْلِكَ رُسُلًا إِلَىٰ قَوْمِهِمْ فَجَآءُوهُم بِٱلْبَيِّنَـٰتِ فَٱنتَقَمْنَا مِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ أَجْرَمُوا۟ ۖ وَكَانَ حَقًّا عَلَيْنَا نَصْرُ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ

They Takfeer Imam Ahmad.

A 7th Century Christian Monk’s Account of Life Under Islamic Rule.

"Justice flourished under his reign, and a great peace was established in the countries that were under his government, and allowed everyone to live as they wished."

John bar Penkaye wrote:

"When they had settled the business according to their methods, the victory fell to the Westerners called Ummayyads, and this after a great slaughter that took place between them. A man among them named Muawiya, took the reins of government of the two empires: Persian and Roman. 

Justice flourished under his reign, and a great peace was established in the countries that were under his government, and allowed everyone to live as they wished. 

They had received, as I said, from the man who was their guide, an order in favour of the Christians and the monks. 

Similarly because of his guidance they held to the worship of one God, according to the customs of the old law. Firstly, they were so attached to the tradition of Muhammad who was their leader, that they inflicted the death penalty on anyone who seemed not to obey his commands. 

Their troops went every year into distant countries and islands, raided and brought back captives from all the nations that are under heaven. 

From every man they required only the tribute, and left him free to hold any belief, and there were even some Christians among them: some belonged to the heretics and others to us. 

While Muawiya reigned there was such a great peace in the world as was never heard of, according to our fathers and our fathers' fathers. It was as if our Lord had said: "I will test you in this way, as it is written: 'by grace and justice iniquity may be pardoned."

(John bar Penkaye, Summary of World History Book 15)

"Indeed, Allāh confers blessing upon the Prophet, and His angels [ask Him to do so]. O you who have believed, ask [Allāh to confer] blessing upon him and ask [Allāh to grant him] peace."

(Surah Al-Ahzab 56)
